smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the provided file contain model elements.

In the Use Case diagram (Page 2), all use cases are associated with an actor, either directly (yellow ovals) or indirectly via inclusion/generalization relationships (the grey oval 'Tuvasta kasutaja' is connected to use cases that have actors).
No distinct use cases with synonymous names describing the same activity were found for the same actor.
No duplicate element names were found within the same package.
Tables appear to use Foreign Keys correctly to reference data (e.g., 'riik_kood') without storing redundant value copies (like 'riik_nimetus') in the referencing table.
All Use Cases on Page 2 start with a verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Lõpeta'), maintaining a consistent naming form.
In the State Diagram (Page 11), all states ('Ootel', 'Aktiivne', etc.) are reachable from the Start state via the defined transitions.
All actions in the Activity Diagrams (Pages 3 and 4) have incoming flows and are reachable from the Start node.
Class and Database diagrams display multiplicity (e.g., '1', '0..*') on the association ends where applicable.
The Use Case diagram 'Filmide funktsionaalne allsüsteem' (Page 2) contains 11 central elements (Use Cases), which exceeds the threshold of 10.

No single class or table in the Class/Database diagrams has 6 or more visual connection lines. (Note: The Use Case 'Tuvasta kasutaja' has 7 connections, but this rule applies to Class or Database diagrams).
The layout of the diagrams is balanced, and related elements are placed in reasonable proximity.
On the Activity Diagram (Page 4), the actions 'Filmi aktiveerimine edukas' and 'Filmi aktiveerimine ebaõnnestub' start with a Noun ('Filmi') instead of an active verb.
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found to be 3 characters or less (excluding standard abbreviations like 'id' inside tags or state names which are not covered by the rule).
All Class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Film').
Attribute and column names start with lowercase letters (e.g., 'nimetus', 'e_meil').
No hungarian notation or type prefixes (e.g., tbl_, str) were found in class, table, or attribute names.
